items.title: At least 8 dead, dozens missing in Indonesian landslide
items.summary_auto: Rescuers were searching for 82 residents feared buried under heaps of mud and debris, while 24 people managed to escape the disaster.

items.title: Authorities working to identify victims of landslide that hit New Zealand campground
items.summary_auto: Rescue efforts have ceased and a recovery operation ⁠is under way, police said, adding that it was unlikely any ‍of those missing are ⁠still alive.

items.title: Latest Russian attacks on Ukraine kill 1 and wound 31 people amid U.S.-led peace talks
items.summary_auto: Russian attacks on Ukraine killed at least one person and wounded 31 overnight into Saturday as negotiators from Ukraine, Russia and the United States were to meet in the United Arab Emirates for a second day of talks to end Russia's nearly four-year full-scale invasion.

items.title: 12-year-old boy dies after shark attack in Australia
items.summary_auto: Australia averages 20 ‍shark attacks ⁠a year, fewer than three of them fatal, according to data from conservation groups.

items.title: Thousands of flights cancelled across U.S. as major winter storm hits
items.summary_auto: The National Weather Service forecast warns of widespread heavy snow and a band of catastrophic ice stretching from east Texas to North Carolina.

items.title: The more Trump allies covet Alberta, the less popular separatism may get
items.summary_auto: Independence movement leaders cheer on U.S. cabinet member's praise, but resist talk of Alberta becoming part of States.

items.title: Once at risk of demolition, this Ontario WW II site will now be restored
items.summary_auto: A historic Second World War site in Bowmanville, Ont., is now safe from demolition, but the cost and responsibility of restoring it is now on the shoulders of the non-profit organization that’s fought to save it for months.

items.title: Heated Rivalry actor Robbie G.K. has a long-standing connection to P.E.I.
items.summary_auto: Before the world saw Robbie G.K. serving up smoothies on screen as Kip Grady in the hit TV series Heated Rivalry, many Islanders saw him on stage at the Confederation Centre of the Arts, performing in the Charlottetown Festival.

items.title: Are librarians the key for teaching AI literacy?
items.summary_auto: Librarians teach students about research, media literacy, copyright and technology. This makes them perfect for teaching about the power and pitfalls of AI. Yet students — from kindergarteners to post-secondary — lose out on this valuable expertise if librarians get overlooked as schools tackle AI.

items.title: For Canada and Carney, the end of the old order is just the start
items.summary_auto: Acknowledging you have a problem — and naming it — is an important and necessary step. It's also obviously just a start.

items.title: Most of the Epstein documents still haven't been released. What's going on?
items.summary_auto: More than a month after a deadline passed for the U.S. Justice Department to release all files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, most are still not available. It's not clear when they will be released as required by law.

items.title: Carney Liberals return to House of Commons still short of a majority
items.summary_auto: Depending on who you ask, the Carney Liberals could be on the cusp of securing a majority — or triggering a general election.

items.title: Comedian Vic Michaelis on their internet talk show, working with Emilia Clarke — and launching an MLM
items.summary_auto: Canadian-raised comedian Vic Michaelis first found viral fame with their internet series Very Important People. Now, they're working on the Emilia Clarke-led series Ponies — and still yearning to star in a disaster movie.

items.title: Does creatine work for menopausal symptoms? Doctors weigh in
items.summary_auto: What the medical literature suggests on who and what might benefit from creatine supplementation and what's less clear.

items.title: Rainy weather delays Alex Honnold's Taipei 101 skyscraper climb by 24 hours
items.summary_auto: Organizers delayed professional rock climber Alex Honnold's ropeless ascent of the Taipei 101 skyscraper for 24 hours due to weather, they said.

items.title: From Alberta to the Atlantic provinces, Canada faces a wind-chilled deep freeze this weekend
items.summary_auto: Much of Canada is grappling with extreme cold heading into the weekend. Here's a breakdown of the conditions in your region, and some tips for dealing with the deep freeze.

items.title: 'Awful, despicable': Canadian veterans slam Trump's comments about NATO troops
items.summary_auto: Canadian veterans of the war in Afghanistan were outraged over comments by U.S. President Donald Trump, who minimized the contributions of NATO forces, claiming they stayed away from the front lines.

items.title: After allegedly killing a ‘rat,’ could Ryan Wedding turn FBI informant himself?
items.summary_auto: As an alleged cocaine kingpin, Ryan Wedding is accused of ordering the murders of rival drug traffickers and an FBI witness he considered a “rat.” Could Wedding, who was arrested Friday after a decade on the run, now be the one to spill what he knows about the drug cartels he worked with?

items.title: Gene-edited pigs deemed safe to eat by Health Canada
items.summary_auto: Food made from pigs engineered to be resistant to a porcine virus are as safe and nutritious to eat as pork currently on the market, Health Canada said Friday.

items.title: 2 dead after U.S. strike on alleged drug boat in Eastern Pacific
items.summary_auto: The U.S. military said Friday that it has carried out a deadly strike on a vessel accused of trafficking drugs in the Eastern Pacific Ocean, the first known attack since the raid that captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro earlier this month.

items.title: Keeping an eye on the far side of the moon
items.summary_auto: While human missions to the moon will be facing Earth, on the other side of the moon, completely hidden from view, there will be a plethora of robots silently peering out to the edge of the universe and back to find out how it all began.

items.title: Quebec revamps its coat of arms, removes British crown
items.summary_auto: The Quebec government announced Friday that it's removing the British crown from the province's official coat of arms, in what it described as a reaffirmation of the province's autonomy.

items.title: Trump's 'Board of Peace' gets its legitimacy from the UN, an agency he routinely belittles
Thousands of demonstrators demand ICE leave Minneapolis
items.summary_auto: Thousands of demonstrators braved bitter cold to march through the streets of Minneapolis on Friday and demand an end to U.S. President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown in their city, part of a wider show of defiance that organizers billed as a general strike.

items.title: B.C. mom with Stage 4 cancer says months-long wait to see oncologist put her at risk
items.summary_auto: A Port Moody, B.C., mother of two says she had to wait three months after being diagnosed with breast cancer to see an oncologist. She worries that wait has cost her precious time. B.C. Cancer data shows that while wait times are improving, British Columbia continues to lag behind other provinces.

items.title: Disgraced Winnipeg police officer sentenced to 7 years in prison 'believed he was untouchable'
items.summary_auto: Former Winnipeg police officer Elston Bostock was sentenced to seven years in prison on Friday, after pleading guilty to a long list of crimes that include selling drugs to friends and other officers and corruption offences.

items.title: 'You cannot rewrite history': Minister rebuffs Trump's claims about allies in Afghanistan
items.summary_auto: Finance Minister François-Philippe Champagne pushed back against U.S. President Donald Trump's latest comments about America's allies in Afghanistan as an attempt to rewrite the history books.
